alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central New Castle, Montgomery, northeastern Chester and western Delaware Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 518 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Westtown, or near West Chester, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, West Chester, Norristown, Pottstown, Phoenixville, Lansdale, West Norriton, East Norriton, Westtown, Downingtown, Souderton, Collegeville, Royersford, Trappe, Hatfield, East Greenville, Schwenksville, Green Lane, Cheyney and Talleyville. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 308 and 328. Northeast Extension between mile markers 27 and 39. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 16 and 17. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 328. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for northern Delaware. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Pennsylvania.
